channel.title: Eclipse Plugins, Bundles and Products - Eclipse Marketplace

item.title: CodeMR
item.description:
Date Updated: 
Mon, 2018-06-18 11:45
CodeMR Software Solution
Date Created: 
Thu, 2018-06-14 20:53
Submitted by: 
CodeMR Team

CodeMR is a software quality and static code analysis tool that helps software companies developing better code, better quality products. 
CodeMR visualizes code metrics and high level quality attributes (Coupling, Complexity, Size) for Java and C++ projects in different views, such as Package Structure, TreeMap, Sunburst, Dependency and Graph Views. 
The graph visualization technique applied in CodeMR is simple yet intuitive. CodeMR has different filtering options and supports custom queries. It visualizes high-level Object Oriented quality attributes and low level metrics. Quality attributes are derived from the combinations of several metrics. You can also create different HTML reports for the project. 
With Community Edition you can extract up to 50 source files and 60 classes. For analyzing more files, you can download a trial license or buy a license from CodeMR website. 
 

Requirements:

  • Eclipse Luna or an upper version

  • Eclipse Java and Eclipse CDT C/C++ Development Tooling

 

For more information, please visit https://www.codemr.co.uk 
Better Code, Better Quality...
item.dc:creator: cteamqoj

item.title: Design and Verification Tools (DVT) IDE for e, SystemVerilog, and VHDL
item.description:
Date Updated: 
Mon, 2018-06-18 09:44
AMIQ EDA
Date Created: 
Wed, 2006-04-19 08:00
Submitted by: 
AMIQ Support

Design and Verification Tools (DVT) is an integrated development environment (IDE) for the e language, SystemVerilog, Verilog, VHDL, and mixed language projects that also provides Universal Verification Methodology (UVM) support. It is similar to well-known programming tools like Visual Studio®, NetBeans®, and IntelliJ®. DVT comprises a proprietary IEEE standard-compliant parser, a smart code editor, an intuitive GUI, a comprehensive set of features that help with code inspection, navigation, documentation, and debugging, and an innovative linting framework. DVT allows design and verification engineers to overcome the limitations of plain text editors and use a modern and powerful tool that enables them to:

  • Increase the speed and quality of new code development
  • Easily understand complex or poorly documented source code
  • Simplify the maintenance of legacy code and reusable libraries
  • Accelerate language and methodology learning
  • Automatically generate well-organized source code documentation

 

FEATURES Some of the features that DVT offers include:

 

  • Autocomplete
  • Compilation errors signaled on the fly
  • In-line reminders for task tracking (TO DOs)
  • Customizable code and project templates
  • Dedicated wizards to generate getters and setters, override functions, or help with UVM factory registration
  • Hyperlinks that help navigate faster in the source code
  • Semantic search
  • Refactoring
  • Macro expansion
  • Class and structural browsing
  • Trace port connections
  • UML diagrams for inspecting and documenting the architecture
  • Module flow diagrams for inspecting and documenting a module structure
  • Automated documentation extraction
  • UVM support and compliance checking
  • Cross-language capabilities for mixed-language projects
  • Vi and emacs emulation

 

INTEGRATION WITH OTHER TOOLS Since it is built on the Eclipse Platform, the DVT IDE can be easily integrated within a large plug-in ecosystem. It also integrates seamlessly with all major hardware simulators such as NCSim , Specman , VCS , and Questa, to enable simplified simulation analysis and debugging. In addition, it works with revision control systems like CVS, Git, Subversion, ClearCase and bug tracking systems such as Bugzilla and ClearQuest.
RESOURCES

 

  • DVT web page
  • DVT datasheet
  • Demo movies
  • UVM Support in DVT
  • DVT Debugger Module

item.title: Structure101 Workspace
item.description:
Date Updated: 
Mon, 2018-06-18 09:28
Structure101
Date Created: 
Fri, 2018-06-15 07:24
Submitted by: 
Paul Hickey

Structure101 Workspace

"It's like Google Maps for your code!”

Stefan Schulze, Lead Architect, Pentasys GmbH 

Structure101 Workspace provides:

  • Live visualization of code dependencies in the context of your overall 'as-is' architecture.
  • Tangles and violations to your defined structure specification are highlighted as they happen – good structure becomes second nature.
  • See how project/modules and packages use each other & drill down to code-level details.
  • Create project/module groups, layering and visibility constraints – common architecture for the team.

Structure101 Workspace can be used as a stand-alone independent product, or in combination with Structure101 Studio, which allows for the publication of a richer set of architecture rules for use with Structure101 Workspace.
item.dc:creator: phickey

item.title: AspectJ Development Tools (Indigo)
item.description:
Date Updated: 
Mon, 2018-06-18 09:24
The Eclipse Foundation
Date Created: 
Wed, 2011-10-26 16:14
Submitted by: 
Andrew Clement

The AspectJ Development Tools (AJDT) project provides Eclipse platform based tool support for AspectJ. Our goal is to deliver a user experience that is consistent with the Java Development Tools (JDT) when working with AspectJ projects and resources.
item.dc:creator: aclement

Date Created:

The AspectJ Development Tools (AJDT) project provides Eclipse platform based tool support for AspectJ. Our goal is to deliver a user experience that is consistent with the Java Development Tools (JDT) when working with AspectJ projects and resources. This marketplace entry is meant for Eclipse Juno (4.2/3.8) only. If you want to install on Eclipse Juni, then you must use the AspectJ Development Tools (Indigo) entry.

item.title: jSparrow - Automatical Java Code Improvement
item.description:
Date Updated: 
Mon, 2018-06-18 04:55
Splendit IT-Consulting GmbH
Date Created: 
Tue, 2017-06-20 11:34
Submitted by: 
Michaela Prehofer

Reliable code management -

jSparrow is an automated Eclipse PlugIn, which finds and replaces different kinds of threats in Java sources with a rule based approach. It improves your Java code and transforms it to Java 7/8.

jSparrow has a set of rules now, which are grouped into seven categories (see rule matrix in our screenshots) and sets a standard logging:
    • String manipulation
    • Formatting
    • Coding Convention
    • Performance
    • Readability
    • Old language constructs
    • Lambda
    • Logging

Removal of potential bugs and code smells is one of the main purposes of jSparrow. jSparrow is very efficient in disposing of these threats with its rules. You can group the profiles into individual rule profiles, which also can be exported and imported to share them within your development team.

Being up to date with the latest Java standards is nornally requiring a lot of manual software maintenance work. jSparrow upgrades old code-artifacts to new state-of-the-art programming practices. The usage of jSparrow´s full version allows you to save a lot of valuable time, while offering the option of automatically upgrading to the latest version of Java within minutes in a safe way.

jSparrow improved his Preview Wizard and the Summary Page. It now estimates the time to fix issues manually. The preview wizard shows the number of issues fixed and estimates your saved time. (see screenshots or our release notes: https://jsparrow.eu/changelog/)

Once you installed jSparrow in your Eclipse – you will SAVE TIME& MONEY in modernizing your Java sources.

LATEST VERSION:

jSparrow Release 2.5.0

OUR RELEASE POLICY IS AS FOLLOWS:

Two major releases per year

    21st June – Midsummer Release
    21st December – Winter solstice Release

Monthly Rule releases

If we developed new rules, they will be released on the 21st of each month - (if the 21st isn’t an Austrian working day- the release will be postponed one month)

Weekly Bugfix releases

Bugfixes will be released each Tuesday

Hotfix Releases 

Hotfix Releases can be deployed any time (hopefully not necessary)

item.title: PL/SQL Enterprise Workbench
item.description:
Date Updated: 
Sun, 2018-06-17 02:26
Jan Richter, Germany, Hamburg
Date Created: 
Mon, 2017-02-27 18:53
Submitted by: 
Jan Richter

PL/SQL Development

  1. The Eclipse-Plugin supports seamless development integration of Java and PL/SQL.
  2. The PL/SQL editor works on local files to support the installed scm system like git subversion, etc.
  3. The PL/SQL editor compiles all types of stored procedures, triggers and types to the database and marks errors and warnings inside the editor and inside a problem view.

PL/SQL Runtime Integation

  1. The PL/SQL Connector Builder generates pure Java JDBC access code that only requires an Oracle JDBC-driver for seamless runtime integration of Java and PL/SQL.
  2. All generated stereotypes are based on core Java EE patterns : implementation classes, service interfaces, transfer objects and service factories.

Supported PL/SQL Connector Builder types

  • Raw-JDBC : Supports core PL/SQL programs calls and allows own control of transaction handling.
  • Java-RPC : Remote PL/SQL programs calls using a Factory API or Spring API.
  • PL/SQL Batch/Stream Processor : Batch processing of typed cursors based on Raw-JDBC or Java-RPC Connector Builder.
  • RMI : Call PL/SQL programs from a client using a Factory API or Spring API via a RMI server.
  • JEE : Generates Java EE session beans to call PL/SQL programs. Optionally generates a remote client to call the Java EE session beans using a Factory API or Spring API.
  • Spring-HTTP-Remoting : Call PL/SQL programs tunneled thru HTTP with Spring HTTP Remoting from a client  with a Factory API or Spring API.

PL/SQL Connector Builder planed til end of 2018

  • RESTful-Services
  • SOAP

Continues Integration

The PL/SQL Connector Builder is implemented as Maven-Plugin as additional download. The PL/SQL Connector Builder Maven-Plugin generates the Java access code during the Maven build process.

Detailed information, examples and download of Maven-Plugin :
www.jr-database-tools.de
item.dc:creator: jrichter847
